Publication of an email and video: The claim was supported by the publication of an email allegedly from Ace Hardware confirming their refusal to sell supplies to Dakota Access pipeline protesters. Additionally, a video was published on Facebook featuring an Ace Hardware employee repeating similar statements.
Article by USUncut: USUncut published an article reporting Ace Hardware's refusal to sell supplies to protesters. The article quoted representatives of the company referring to "incendiary" products.
Official statement from Ace Hardware: Ace Hardware issued an official statement stating that stores in the vicinity of the pipeline protests had been requested by law enforcement officials to refrain from selling materials that could be used at the camps.
Customer response on social media: Posters on Ace Hardware's official Facebook page pledged to discontinue doing business with the chain if the ban on selling supplies to protesters remained in place.
